$interpreted: Aosta: (The amount of data professor left behind is staggering. How many days have I spent on it already...)
Elio: Mr. Clovis!? How did you...oh, so this is the place you asked father to let you into to?
Aosta: ... You dirty thief!? You're not getting away!
Elio: Wait, I...
Aosta: Just as I suspected, you just used one of professor Dietrich's spells. Moreover, I've never mentioned my last name, yet you know the name "Clovis".
Aosta: Explain yourself.
Elio: I will...could you please let me go first...
Elio: Whew~ When I was little, I somehow snuck my way inside this sealed lab.
Elio: When I was exploring and messing around, the documents and notes left here caught my eye...
Aosta: You mean you were able to learn professor's spells by reading the notes he left behind?
Elio: Yes. I was very interested in them. Therefore, I often visited here in secret to read and practice arcane magic...
Aosta: I see; but if so, how did you know my last name?
Elio: He has a diary with stories about you. Have you never seen it?
Aosta: ......Where is it?
Aosta: (So this past incident was why professor took me in as his apprentice...)
Aosta: (Never thought that professor would have a female before me.)
Elio: Judging from these notes he left behind, professor Dietrich had a unique way of thinking; quite the dedicated researcher too.
Elio: He was a very reliable and mature teacher, wasn't he?
Aosta: Reliable? Mature? ...*chuckles* ... I'd say exactly the opposite...
Elio: Oh, no worries. I will forget anything about you in those diary pages. My lips are tightly sealed...
Aosta: Hmph...but this does explain why despite Charle being the leader of Applied Magic, you, his son, chose Life Magic instead.
Aosta: Turns out you were influenced by professor Dietrich.
Elio: To be honest, father treats me like he treats every other student. As long as I study and make progress in a field I'm interested in,
Elio: he won't force me to inherit his knowledge and skills...
Aosta: You are his biological son though; wouldn't he have some special expectations for you?
Elio: No, I was merely adopted by the headmaster. I am not related to him by blood...
Aosta: By the way, why did you sneak in here tonight?
Elio: Tomorrow, I'm joining the princess' forces along with a group of students. Tonight is my last night at Rune Academy.
Elio: Therefore, I planned to come here and say goodbye to this secret playground of mine.
Aosta: Then say your goodbyes and leave. I have other things to tend to; don't stay here and disturb me.
Elio: Well then, farewell, professor Morris Dietrich. Thank you for your company throughout all these years.
Elio: Mr. Clovis, farewell to you as well. I'll take my leave.
Aosta: Why did this happen?
Aosta: Adopted son of Charle, what did you just do?
Experiment: C-Clovis...
Aosta: It's happening again...just what in the world is this...?

Model.Text: (The amount of data professor left behind is staggering. How many days have I spent on it already...)
Mr. Clovis!? How did you...oh, so this is the place you asked father to let you into to?
... You dirty thief!? You're not getting away!
Wait, I...
Just as I suspected, you just used one of professor Dietrich's spells. Moreover, I've never mentioned my last name, yet you know the name "Clovis".
Explain yourself.
I will...could you please let me go first...
Whew~ When I was little, I somehow snuck my way inside this sealed lab.
When I was exploring and messing around, the documents and notes left here caught my eye...
You mean you were able to learn professor's spells by reading the notes he left behind?
Yes. I was very interested in them. Therefore, I often visited here in secret to read and practice arcane magic...
I see; but if so, how did you know my last name?
He has a diary with stories about you. Have you never seen it?
......Where is it?
(So this past incident was why professor took me in as his apprentice...)
(Never thought that professor would have a female before me.)
Judging from these notes he left behind, professor Dietrich had a unique way of thinking; quite the dedicated researcher too.
He was a very reliable and mature teacher, wasn't he?
Reliable? Mature? ...*chuckles* ... I'd say exactly the opposite...
Oh, no worries. I will forget anything about you in those diary pages. My lips are tightly sealed...
Hmph...but this does explain why despite Charle being the leader of Applied Magic, you, his son, chose Life Magic instead.
Turns out you were influenced by professor Dietrich.
To be honest, father treats me like he treats every other student. As long as I study and make progress in a field I'm interested in,
he won't force me to inherit his knowledge and skills...
You are his biological son though; wouldn't he have some special expectations for you?
No, I was merely adopted by the headmaster. I am not related to him by blood...
By the way, why did you sneak in here tonight?
Tomorrow, I'm joining the princess' forces along with a group of students. Tonight is my last night at Rune Academy.
Therefore, I planned to come here and say goodbye to this secret playground of mine.
Then say your goodbyes and leave. I have other things to tend to; don't stay here and disturb me.
Well then, farewell, professor Morris Dietrich. Thank you for your company throughout all these years.
Mr. Clovis, farewell to you as well. I'll take my leave.
Why did this happen?
Adopted son of Charle, what did you just do?
C-Clovis...
It's happening again...just what in the world is this...?
